The Mental in Mental Disorder
3. The Mental in Mental Disorder

In a once-common practice, mental or “functional”
disorders were diagnosed just when no somatic traits were evident.
Such language is now explicitly disavowed, eclipsed by a growing
recognition that all disorders involve bodily states ( APA 2013: 309;
O’Leary 2021). Still, the “mental” in mental
disorder is variously construed.
